comment.body: I once had a look at it. Seems interesting, but I couldn't come up with a real use case for it. The only idea was for hosting zeronet, and having a car or something that cycles between the different instances for synchronization. But that's really far fetched. Then again, the internet is way faster, and reliable enough to do that.
I'm from Switzerland. Our country was founded 726 years ago, when our ancestors no longer wanted to serve foreign lords.

No Justification for Spanish Internet Censorship During Catalonian Referendum 
https://www.eff.org/deeplinks/2017/10/no-justification-spanish-internet-censorship-during-catalonian-referendum
